hackathon-description-text: Blue Compass is honored to be partnering with George Mason University’s Schar School of Policy and Government -Terrorism, Transnational Crime and Corruption Center (TraCCC) on a Human Trafficking focused hackathon as a part of #ExpeditionHacks event series.  Human trafficking is a global enterprise that is second only to drug trafficking as the most profitable criminal business.  It takes many forms, including labor trafficking and sex trafficking. Create a solution to help combat human trafficking or assist its victims, using artificial intelligence/machine learning, augmented reality, or anything else!  Some ideas to consider:
hackathon-eligibility: All participants must agree to the
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Founders Hall, 3351 Fairfax Dr, Arlington, VA 22201, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How impactful will this solution be for it’s target audience? Is it scalable?
How well designed is this solution, from front end through to UI/UX?
How well executed is this solution from start to finish?
